e.  Facility Emergency Response Program

The South Charleston Emergency Response System consists of volunteer emergency response teams from Covestro and the host company that work rotating shifts and straight days.  The goal is to have between 3 and 6 emergency squad members always available on shift and this group is supplemented by straight day people, call outs and the South Charleston Fire Department which is located within 1/2 miles of the facility.  The Covestro and host site emergency squad people receive approximately 16 to 24 hours of on-site training annually with some disciplines receiving off-site training as well in specialized subjects, such as fire fighting, rescue, incident command and Hazmat.  In the case of a significant fire or community impact the South Charleston Fire department would be involved.  The plant also participates in local fire and industrial mutual aid systems through the Kanawha Putnam Emergency Planning Committee (KPEPC).
Community warning sirens are placed in multiple places in the Kanawha Valley and there is one within 1 mile of the plant. 

The South Charleston Plant host (DOW) maintains a written emergency response program to protect worker and public safety, as well as the environment.  The program consists of procedures for responding to releases of hazardous substances, including the possibility of a fire or explosion if a flammable substance is accidentally released.  The procedures address all aspects of emergency response including:

*	Proper first-aid and medical treatment for exposures 
*	Evacuation plans and accounting for personnel after an evacuation
*	Notification of local emergency response agencies and the public if a release occurs
*	Post-incident cleanup and decontamination requirements, and
*	Inspecting, testing, maintaining, and using eme

rgency response equipment.

The emergency response program is updated when necessary based on modifications made to facility processes.

ylonitrile (ACN) at the Dow Massey Railyard.  Our ACN suppliers own all of the ACN railcar fleet. Covestro owns the ACN material inside the ACN Railcar(s) once it is loaded into the railcars by the acrylonitrile supplier and exits their facility by purchasing agreement.  CSX delivers the ACN railcar(s) to the Massey Railyard for a typical storage period of 1 to 30 days.  Once CSX places the ACN Railcar(s) in the Massey Railyard, the ACN railcar(s) is no longer under active shipping papers.  Upon request from Covestro and Dow, CSX transfers the ACN Railcar(s) from Massey Railyard, through the CSX railroad property, onto the South Charleston Plant to the Covestro ACN unloading station within the South Charleston Plant.  The South Charleston Plant is owned by Dow and Covestro is a tenant at the facility. Covestro leases part of the South Charleston Plant for its operations and stores 1 to 7 ACN railcars at the Massey Railyard during a typical month.  The DOW Massey Yard is not covered under the PSM Regulations.   Massey Yard is not a process and is a normally unoccupied remote facility. There are no Covestro or DOW employees located at the DOW Massey Railyard.  

In summary the Covestro portion of DOW Massey Railyard has one (1) RMP listed toxic chemicals and no flammable chemicals. The RMP toxic chemical was modeled using worst case release parameters as a screening exercise to determine the distance to toxic endpoint.   

c.  Accidental Release Prevention Program and Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps

The South Charleston Plant complies with all elements of the EPA RMP Rule.  There are safety procedures, standard operation emergency procedures, accident investigations, hot work and line opening permits, extensive training programs, on-site emergency response teams, vessel inspection programs, and trained personnel both in the salaried and hourly workforce.

b.  Facility Description and Regulated Substances Handled

The Massey Railyard is owned by Dow and is separated from the South Charleston Plant by the CSX Railroad property, highway and other local businesses. The Dow Massey Rail Yard is used to temporarily store tank cars for eventual processing at the South Charleston Plant. The railyard is managed by the South Charleston Plant, but is not considered contiguous by EPA definition with the South Charleston Plant. The CSX Railroad property sits between the Massey Railyard and the South Charleston Plant. No chemical transfer takes place at the Massey Railyard.  Covestro has a contract with Dow to use the Dow Massey Railyard to store chemical raw material and product railcars until they are needed in the Covestro South Charleston Plant or shipped to other destinations in the case of Polyol products.

a.  Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies

Covestro LLC is committed to the principles of Responsible Care which emphasize operating in a safe and environmentally correct manner. Management systems are in place to assure all facilities are complying with these principles.  There are Corporate Engineering Standards and Health, Environment and Safety Guidelines which address every aspect of Risk Management from design of intrinsically safe processes, to the use of risk assessment, to incident tracking and program audits. Covestro LLC was formerly a division of Bayer AG, but is now a separate company and is classified as a subsidiary of Bayer AG since Bayer owns a majority of the Covestro stock. Covestro is headquartered in Leverkusen, Germany. The US (country) headquarters for Covestro is located in Pittsburgh, PA.  Covestro LLC has its own company structure, policies and procedures which are consistent with those of the holding company, but are customized to meet local regulations and standards.  Covestro has established guidelines for Responsible Care in Environmental Protection and Safety, which include a Directive for Process and Plant Safety that all Covestro facilities world-wide are expected to follow.  It provides guidance for safe process design and operation.

In the US, Covestro LLC is an active member of the American Chemistry Council's Responsible Care Initiative.  Covestro has implemented all seven codes (Pollution Prevention, Distribution, Product Stewardship, Employee health & Safety, Security: and Community Awareness & Emergency Response) of management practice.  Covestro has a Health, Safety, Environment, Energy and Quality Policy which states that it is the company's responsibility to protect the environment and the hea

lth and safety of its employees, customers and communities.  This is a primary responsibility, of equal importance to any other business objective.  This is supported in the Covestro LLC Visions, Values and Beliefs, which emphasize applying technical expertise to advance our business while assuring the safety and protection of our employees, customers, communities and the environment.

At DOW Massey Railyard, Covestro has implemented all of the corporate Health Environment and Safety Policies and Guidelines through site policies and procedures.  These include site Safety and Health Procedures, Emergency Response Procedures, Hazard Communication Procedures and Risk Management Procedures. 

Covestro has a contract with Union Carbide Corporation, a subsidiary of DOW Chemical, to use the Dow Massey Railyard to stage/store chemical raw material and product railcars until they are required in the Covestro South Charleston Plant or in the case of product shipped to the customer.  There is no transfer of materials at DOW Massey Railyard, only storage. Covestro has a contract with DOW (Union Carbide) for emergency response services and security.
